Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); GRAECO-ROMAN PERIOD (not after)
Technique: PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL ?; PAINTED ?; FAYENCE
Name: Vase with the god Bes
Description: This figurine in faience, of which the provenance is not known, shows the god Bes, standing, presenting a large vase which he has placed before him. The  dwarf god is depicted under his classical aspect, but the hair style is not preserved. The piece dates from the Late Period or from the Ptolemaic Period.
